sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of consumer behavior occurring in a market
message_1: A market research firm surveys a random sample of 500 consumers and finds that 140 of them regularly purchase a new smartphone every year. Calculate the probability of a randomly chosen consumer to purchase a new smartphone in a year from this market.
message_2:
To calculate the probability of a randomly chosen consumer purchasing a new smartphone in a year, we need to divide the number of consumers who regularly purchase a new smartphone by the total number of consumers surveyed.

Number of consumers who regularly purchase a new smartphone = 140
Total number of consumers surveyed = 500

Probability = (Number of consumers who regularly purchase a new smartphone) / (Total number of consumers surveyed)

Probability = 140 / 500

Probability = 0.28

So, the probability of a randomly chosen consumer purchasing a new smartphone in a year from this market is 0.28 or 28%.
